questions.text: Which one of the following does not originate from PARAMESONEPHRIC ducts?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Epithelium of vagina
Paramesonephric Ducts are Mullerian ducts. In females, these ducts form uterus, cervix, fallopian tubes, upper 1/3rd of vagina and hydatid of Morgagni. In males, these ducts form prostatic utricle and appendix of testes. 
Epithelium of vagina is formed from the urogenital sinus.

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida has 38 weeks of gestation with cephalic presentation, her fundal height is 32 centimetric and the head of the fetus is at station +1. According to Johnson's formula, how much is the expected fetal weight
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

3.25 KG
As per Johnson’s formula, fetal weight is equal to (fundal height – 12) x 155. If the head of the baby is engaged then we need to replace 12 by 11. In this case, the head of the baby is engaged since the station is +1. So, the weight is (32-11) x 155 = 3255 gm

choices.text: Anterior division of internal iliac artery
Posterior division of internal iliac artery

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida had severe post-partum hemorrhage after full term delivery. A decision was made to perform stepwise devascularization surgery. Which of the following vessels would not be ligated during this procedure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Posterior division of internal iliac artery
Posterior division of the internal iliac artery is not responsible for supplying blood to the uterus.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the correct sequence of blood supply to the uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Arcuate – radial - basal and spiral

choices.text: Progesterone is maximum in mid luteal phase

questions.text: Which one of the following findings is correct about ovarian cycle?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All are correct

choices.text: Primary oocyte is formed after mitotic division from oogonium
Secondary oocyte is formed at birth after completion of meiosis 1
Mature ovum is formed after completion of meiosis one at puberty
Migration of germ cells would occur even if only one X chromosome is present in female embryo

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about gametogenesis in ovary?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Primary oocyte is formed after mitotic division from oogonium 
Meiosis gets arrested at birth. It gets over at puberty to form secondary oocyte and first polar body. Mature ovum is formed after the completion of meiosis 2 at the time of fertilisation. It requires 2X chromosomes for migration of oogonium to the gonadal ridge.

choices.text: Torsion of FIGO-4 type of fibroid

questions.text: A 23 years old pregnant patient has come with history of pain in abdomen since last 2 days. She is a known case of fibroid uterus. She has fever, leucocytosis and 18 weeks of gestation. Which one of the following is a likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Red degeneration of fibroid 
Red degeneration of fibroid is specific for second trimester of pregnancy. It is due to venous thrombosis; it causes acute pain in abdomen with fever and WBC count is also increased.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not used in the treatment of red degeneration of fibroid?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Antibiotics 
Red degeneration of fibroid is a self-limiting condition which is due to venous thrombosis. Conservative management is the best line of management in this case. We treat the patient by analgesic, antipyretic, IV fluids, bedrest and sedation. Antibiotics and myomectomy are not indicated in this case.

questions.text: Which one of the following is a risk factor for the development of endometriosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

K-ras mutation 
K-ras gene mutation is responsible for increasing the risk of endometriosis by seven times. All other mentioned conditions are responsible for decreasing the risk of endometriosis.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common symptom of a patient suffering from endometriosis of the pelvis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Dysmenorrhoea
The most common symptom of a patient who is suffering from endometriosis is dysmenorrhoea, which is cyclic pelvic pain. Other symptoms are dyspareunia, infertility, chronic pelvic pain and menstrual abnormalities.

questions.text: The symptoms of the patient suffering from endometriosis depends upon which character?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The depth of the disease 
Symptoms of the patient of endometriosis would depend upon the depth of the disease. Deep infiltrating endometriosis is the most symptomatic endometriosis.

questions.text: What is an ideal level of spinal anesthesia for doing cesarean section?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

T4
Ideal level of spinal anaesthesia for doing caesarean section is T4 since we need to open the abdomen.

questions.text: After how many days of fertilization does implantation occur in uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

6 days 
fertilization to implantation gap would be of six days to seven days. Implantation occurs in blastocyst stage. The most common site is on the posterior wall of the uterus near fundus.

choices.text: Alpha chain is same in HCG and growth hormone
Maximum levels of hCG are found at 10 weeks
Hcg doubles up in less than 48 hours in a case of Ectopic pregnancy

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about hCG in pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Maximum levels of hCG are found at 10 weeks 
HCG in pregnancy is produced by syncitiotrophoblast. The alpha chain of hCG is same as in LH,FSH and TSH. hCG rises very slowly in ectopic pregnancy, doubling time will be more than 48 hours. the average doubling time in a normal pregnancy is 48 hours. Maximum levels are found in the first trimester at around 10 weeks.

questions.text: Identify the following picture of early gestation:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Double bleb sign 
This is a picture of double bleb sign. In this picture, we are able to see a gestational sac containing amniotic sac and yolk sac along with embryonic disc.

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida has ultrasonography report showing single intrauterine gestational sack of 20 mm with crown rump length of four mm but cardiac activity is not visualized. Which one of the following is the best management option in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Repeat USG after seven days
The critical cut off to visualize cardiac activity is crown rum length of 7 mm. In this case, the crown rum length is just 4 mm. So, we can wait and watch. The correct answer in this case is to repeat ultrasonography after seven days.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a risk factor for ectopic pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Copper T
Copper-T is not a risk factor for ectopic pregnancy but failure of Copper-T is indeed a risk factor for ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: Which one of the following is specific for rupture in a case of ectopic pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Shoulder tip pain
In a case of ruptured ectopic, there is hemoperitoneum. Hemoperitoneum irritates the phrenic nerve of the diaphragm which results in referred-pain to the shoulder tip. It is a specific marker of ruptured ectopic pregnancy.

choices.text: Exploratory laparotomy followed by delivery of the fetus and placenta
Exploratory laparotomy followed by delivery of fetus but leave the placenta behind
Continue pregnancy till 34 weeks and deliver at 34 weeks by exploratory laparotomy

questions.text: A 33 years old female has abdominal ectopic pregnancy of 22 weeks of gestation. MRI was done and it was found that the placenta was densely adherent to the mesentery. What is the best line of treatment in such case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Exploratory laparotomy followed by delivery of fetus but leave the placenta behind 
In a case of abdominal ectopic pregnancy, we perform exploratory laparotomy and then we deliver the fetus but we leave the placenta behind for autolysis. Any attempt of removal of placenta may lead to profuse bleeding causing hemorrhagic shock and death.

questions.text: The most sensitive investigation for iron deficiency anemia is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Serum ferritin 
Serum ferritin is the most sensitive investigation for iron deficiency anemia.
MCHC is most sensitive RBC index of iron deficiency anemia.

choices.text: Give oral iron plus injectable iron therapy

questions.text: A 32 years old pregnant patient has 18 weeks of gestation with haemoglobin of 4 gm%. Her serum ferritin is very low, her pulse is 102 and her BP is 100/60. What is the best treatment in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Give blood transfusion
Any patient with haemoglobin of less than 5 g percent at any week of gestation must be treated by blood transfusion because it is a threat to maternal life.

questions.text: Calculate the dose of injectable iron required in a patient whose body weight is 60 KG and her haemoglobin is 7 g percent:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

1076 mg 
According to Ganzoni’s formula, the dose of injectable iron is {2.4 x weight in kilogram x Hb deficit} +500mg. In this case, Hb deficit is 11-7 = 4 gm percent. We have to add 500 mg for the iron stores. So, the correct answer to this case is 1076 mg.

questions.text: A 24 years old diabetic patient wants to conceive. She had one full term normal delivery five years ago. Her diabetes was detected two years ago. How much amount of folic acid must be given to her in order to prevent neural tube defect in the fetus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

400 µg every day 
May the patient be diabetic or not, the prophylactic dose of folic acid for prevention of neural tube defect remains 400 µg every day. In cases where there is past history of neural tube defect or patient is taking antiepileptic medication, we give 4000 µg per day.

questions.text: The most common neonatal complication seen in infant of diabetic mother is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

hypoglycemia 
The most common complication seen in infant of diabetic mother is hypoglycemia. This is due to increased neonatal insulin. It is high because beta cells of pancreas are hypertrophied.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a known complication in an infant of GDM patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ventricular defect
GDM is not responsible for congenital malformations in the fetus because it is a disease of second half of pregnancy. So, ventricular defect would not be seen in infant of GDM patient.

questions.text: Which one of the following investigations is not required in evaluation of gestational diabetes mellitus patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

USG Doppler 
GDM patients do not suffer from IUGR since there is no vasculopathy in a new onset diabetes. IUGR is seen in overt diabetes. So, USG Doppler has no role in the management of gestational diabetes mellitus.

choices.text: Diabetic mother with expected baby weight of 3.2 KG
Non-diabetic mother with expected baby weight of 4.2 KG
Diabetic mother with expected baby weight of 4.8 KG
Non-diabetic mother with expected baby weight of 4.6 KG

questions.text: Which one of the following is an indication of doing cesarean section?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Diabetic mother with expected baby weight of 4.8 KG 
Indication of doing caesarean section in diabetic patient is when expected fetal weight is 4.5 KG or more and a non-diabetic patient it is 5 KG or more. This is done to prevent shoulder dystocia.

choices.text: Injection ANTI-D dose is 300 µg after delivery
O negative packed cell transfusion is done if moderate to anemia is present in fetus
It is the most common cause of immune hydrops fetalis
After delivery, the baby suffers from neonatal anemia and jaundice

questions.text: In a case of Rh incompatibility with fetal anemia, which one of the following is an incorrect option?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Injection ANTI-D dose is 300 µg after delivery 
Injection ANTI-D is not required if patient is already iso-immunised. If there is fetal anemia in Rh incompatibility, it means that patient is already iso-immunised. ANTI-D injection is meant for prevention of isoimmunisation and not for treatment of isoimmunisation.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not included in quadruple marker test?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Unconjugated estradiol 
Quadruple marker test is made up of free beta hCG, alpha feto protein, unconjugated estriol and inhibin A. Estradiol is not a component of quadruple market test.

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida has positive quadruple marker test with risk of Down’s syndrome as 1:200. She was advised amniocentesis but she denied the same. What is the next best option in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

NIPT 
If the screening test called quadruple marker test is positive for Down’s syndrome then patient is advised confirmatory test called amniocentesis but if patient denies amniocentesis due to any reason whatsoever then we do NIPT testing. NIPT is the most sensitive screening test for trisomy. It is used as secondary screening tool. It is very costly but it has sensitivity of 99% with false positivity of 0.1%.

questions.text: A 24 years old G2P1L1 has 16 weeks of gestation with cervical length of 2.1 centimetre. Her internal os is closed. She also has history of preterm delivery at 30 weeks of gestation in past. What is the correct treatment plan for this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

A and B 
If any patient has past history of preterm labour then we do monthly-ultrasonography and give progesterone support. In monthly-sonography, if it is found that cervical length is shorter than 2.5 cm then we do cervical cerclage operation as well.

choices.text: It generates pressure of 600 to 660 mm Hg
It can evacuate a first trimester pregnancy till 12 weeks

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about the given instrument?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Capacity is 30 ML 
This instrument is manual vacuum aspiration syringe. It has capacity of 60 ML. It is used for doing suction and evacuation till 12 weeks of pregnancy. It generates pressure of 600 to 660 mm Hg.

questions.text: Identify the given instrument:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cusco speculum 
The given instrument is Cusco's speculum. It is a self-retaining speculum. There is no need of assistant for using this instrument. It is meant for retracting the anterior and posterior walls of vagina for visualization of cervix and lateral walls of vagina.

questions.text: After performing suction evacuation in a patient with molar pregnancy, hCG monitoring was performed every week. Patient was advised to use contraception for avoiding pregnancy. Which one of the following contraceptives would not be advised in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Copper T 
In a patient who has undergone suction evacuation for molar pregnancy, hCG monitoring is performed every week till it becomes negative for three times then we do monthly hCG evaluation for six months. In a complete molar pregnancy, in surveillance period, pregnancy is not allowed. Low dose OC pills are contraceptives of choice. Implant progesterone or injectable progesterone therapy can also be given. Copper-T is contraindicated in such cases due to risk of perforation and bleeding.

choices.text: Green coloured amniotic fluid == fetal distress
Golden coloured amniotic fluid == hemolysis in fetus
Dark red amniotic fluid == placenta previa

questions.text: Which one of the following is an incorrect pair?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Dark red amniotic fluid == placenta previa 
Dark red amniotic fluid is seen in abruptio placenta due to old collected blood.

questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 has developed HELLP syndrome. Which one of the following investigations is not matching with the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Raised haptoglobin 
In a case of HELLP syndrome, there will be hemolysis which would cause increase in LDH and decrease in haptoglobin levels. There is elevation of liver enzyme levels and bilirubin is also raised. This bilirubin is unconjugated bilirubin. Platelet count is found to be less than one lakh.

choices.text: Drug of choice is URSODEOXYCHOLIC ACID and we can continue pregnancy till 37 weeks

questions.text: In case of acute fatty liver of pregnancy, which one of the following clinical/investigational findings would not be present?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Drug of choice is URSODEOXYCHOLIC ACID and we can continue pregnancy till 37 weeks
In a case of acute fatty liver of pregnancy, there is yellow necrosis of liver. Pregnancy should be terminated immediately. Continuing pregnancy may cause liver failure and death.

choices.text: Wait and watch for spontaneous labour
Induction of labour and vagina delivery

questions.text: At 32 years old primigravida with 33 weeks of the gestation has had a road traffic accident. She developed acute pain in abdomen and she also had vagina bleeding. On clinical examination, uterus was stony hard and USG revealed retro placental clot of 7 cm size. Fetal heart sound was absent and her vitals were unstable with BP of 80/40 mm Hg. On PV examination, it was found that her cervix was 2cm-dilated. What is the best line of management in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Emergency LSCS 
In a case of abruptio placenta with maternal shock, we must do emergency LSCS to save the life of mother.

questions.text: Point mutation in SRY gene leads to which clinical condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Swyer syndrome
Point mutation of SRY gene is responsible for SWYER syndrome. In this case, there is bilateral gonadal dysgenesis and the karyotype is 46XY.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of Kallmann syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Short stature 
In a case of Kallman syndrome, there is KAL-1 gene mutation. It leads to GnRH cell deficiency causing primary amenorrhoea and anosmia. LH and FSH levels are very low and hence estrogen and progesterone levels are very low. Height of this patient would be normal because growth hormone levels are not affected.

choices.text: Breast development at the age of nine years
Menopause at the age of 42 years
Menarche at the age of 11 years
Normal menses at the age of 56 years.

questions.text: Which one of the following cases would require evaluation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Normal menses at the age of 56 years.

Delayed menopause is defined as no menopause till the age of 55 years. In this case, there is an increased risk of endometrial carcinoma and hence endometrial sampling or biopsy is compulsory to rule out cancer.

questions.text: A 16 years old female with short stature has come with history of primary amenorrhoea. Her secondary sexual characters are poorly developed. Which one of the following is the next line of investigation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Karyotype 
In a case of primary amenorrhoea, the first line of investigation is always ultrasonography. It tells us about the status of uterus and gonads. Once ultrasonography is done, we do karyotype as investigation of choice to know the genotype of the patient.

questions.text: A 23 years old female with severe pre-eclampsia with headache and blurring of vision, has come to the OPD. Which one of the following is the first treatment for this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Anti-convulsant 
In a patient with severe preeclampsia with symptoms of impending eclampsia, we always start the treatment by giving prophylactic anti-convulsant therapy and the drug of choice is magnesium sulphate. Then we give steroids and antihypertensive drug and then we terminate pregnancy if 34 weeks are over or if patient is unstable.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is responsible for Ebstein's anomaly in the fetus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Lithium 
Ebstein’s anomaly in the fetus is caused by lithium. It is used in bipolar disorders in psychiatry.

questions.text: For the prediction of Preeclampsia we must do doppler of which vessel?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Uterine artery 
Doppler of uterine artery at 12 to 14 weeks will show reduced diastolic flow in a patient who is destined to develop preeclampsia of early onset.

choices.text: Maximum levels are seen at 10 weeks
The production of HPL is more than any other hormone from placenta
HPL is responsible for insulin resistance in pregnancy

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect about human placenta lactogen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Maximum levels are seen at 10 weeks
Human placenta lactogen is produced by syncitiotrophoblast. Maximum levels are seen at 35 to 36 weeks. It is produced at the rate of 1 g per day which is higher than any other hormone and it is responsible for insulin resistance in pregnancy leading to hyperglycemia.

questions.text: Which of the following hematological changes in pregnancy is/are physiological?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All of the above
Physiological hematological changes include hemodilution, physiological anemia, neutrophilia, leucocytosis, increase in all clotting factors except factor 11 and 13 and reduced RBC concentration. Platelet count falls to low normal levels.

questions.text: All of the following are physiological changes in the endocrine system in pregnancy except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Goitre 
Thyroid binding globulin is increased in pregnancy due to estrogen. T3 and T4 levels are increased in pregnancy due to hCG but free T3 and free T4 levels are constant in pregnancy. Hence pregnancy is euthyroid condition. Goitre is always pathological.

choices.text: Do Chorion villous sampling and karyotype

questions.text: A 33 years old female who was pregnant for second time has 18 weeks of gestation. Her quadruple marker test was done and it showed alpha feto protein levels of three times the normal value. What is the next line of management in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Do 3-D USG 
If quadruple marker test shows increased alpha feto protein levels then it is a screening positivity for neural tube defect and the best way of evaluating and confirming neural tube defect is 3-D ultrasonography.

choices.text: Spectrophotometry for golden coloured amniotic fluid

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a lung maturity test?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Spectrophotometry for golden coloured amniotic fluid
Spectrophotometry for golden coloured amniotic fluid is a test for detection of fetal anemia. All other given tests are tests of lung maturity.

questions.text: A 35 years old G2P1L1 has history of preterm delivery at 31 weeks of gestation. Now she is 16 weeks pregnant and her cervical length is 3 cm and her internal os is closed. What should be the best plan of action in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Vaginal progesterone support 
In this case there is a patient who has history of preterm delivery at 31 weeks in past. Her cervical length is three cm which is more than 2.5 so it is adequate. So, we are not supposed to do cervical cerclage surgery in this case but we are supposed to give progesterone support till term and monthly USG would be done in order to check whether there is any evidence of shortening of cervix or not.

choices.text: It is triploid in most cases
Uterus is less than period of gestation in most cases

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about partial mole?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

p57 marker is negative
In a case of partial mole, there is multispermy so the fetus is triploid or above. Most commonly it is triploid. Fetus is congenitally malformed and that is why the uterus is less than period of gestation. Maternal chromosomes are present but paternal chromosomes are many and that is why trophoblastic proliferation is in excess. P57 marker is positive in a case of partial mole and it is negative in a case of complete mole.

questions.text: What is the treatment of choice in a 42 years old multiparous patient with complete molar pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

hysterectomy 
Elderly multiparous patient with molar pregnancy must be subjected to hysterectomy but there is no need of removal of ovaries or the cyst. There is a need of HCG evaluation every week even after hysterectomy.

choices.text: 6 mg i.m., four doses, 12-12 hours apart
12 mg i.m., two doses, 24 hours apart
6 mg i.m., four doses, six hours apart

questions.text: In order to achieve lung maturity of the fetus, which one of the following is the correct dose and schedule of dexamethasone therapy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

6 mg i.m., four doses, 12-12 hours apart 
The correct dose and schedule of dexamethasone therapy is 6 mg i.m., four doses, 12 hours apart. The window of steroid therapy is 24 to 36+6 weeks. It prevents respiratory distress syndrome, necrotising enterocolitis and intra ventricular hemorrhage.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not an effect of magnesium sulphate toxicity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Oliguria 
Magnesium sulphate toxicity leads to blunting of DTR or absence of DTR. It leads to respiratory depression and respiratory arrest. It leads to stupor and somnolence. Oliguria is not an effect of toxicity but it is the cause of toxicity.

questions.text: Cord entanglement is a specific complication of which type of twin pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

MCMA
Cord entanglement is seen when there is monochorionic monoamniotic twinning since both the babies are sharing the same amniotic sac and there is no septum in between the two babies. In these cases, we do elective LSCS at 34 weeks to prevent such complications.

choices.text: Hydro fetalis in the baby or babies

questions.text: Which one of the following is not seen in T-A-P-S?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Oligohydramnios and polyhydramnios in babies 
Twin anemia polycythaemia sequence will have anemia and one baby and polycythaemia in another baby. It is seen in MCMA twins. There is no oligo-poly complex because there is only one sac. This is a mild version of twin-twin transfusion syndrome.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not an indication of doing cesarean section?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

HIV in pregnancy 
In India, HIV is not an indication of doing caesarean section. We conduct vaginal delivery but we avoid ARM, episiotomy, invasive fetal monitoring and instrumental delivery.

choices.text: It is due to head compression in lab
It shows decelerations with every contraction
It is a gradual type of deacceleration
It requires immediate intervention and delivery

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about the given graph?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

It requires immediate intervention and delivery
This graph in labour is due to head compression. It shows early decelerations. These decelerations are gradual type of decelerations. These decelerations are physiological decelerations which occur with contractions. There is no need of any intervention.

questions.text: Identify the given picture of perineal tear:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Fourth degree
In the given picture, there is a perineal tear involving anal sphincter as well as anal mucosa so it is a 4th degree perineal tear.

choices.text: Ideal time of episiotomy is during crowning of head
Primigravida is an indication of episiotomy
Most common episiotomy is mediolateral episiotomy
Suture material required for suturing episiotomy is absorbable suture material

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about episiotomy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Primigravida is an indication of episiotomy 
Ideal time of giving episiotomy is during crowning of head or during climbing of breech. Routine episiotomy is outdated concept. Primigravida is not an indication of episiotomy. The most common episiotomy is mediolateral episiotomy. It is 60° away from midline. It has less chance of sphincter injuries. We use absorbable suture material for suturing episiotomy.

questions.text: During clinical pelvimetry, PV examination was done to measure the distance between sacral promontory to lower border of pubic symphysis. This distance is called as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Diagonal conjugate 
PV examination is done to evaluate the distance between sacral promontory and lower border of pubic symphysis. It is called as diagonal conjugate and it is 12 cm on an average. DC -1.5 is OC (obstetric conjugate). OC is the most critical diameter of inlet.

choices.text: A pathological retraction ring called Shroeder’s ring is seen abdominally.
It occurs due to cephalo-pelvic disproportion or neglected shoulder presentation
It is a precursor of rupture of uterus
It is more common in multiparous patient

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about obstructed labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A pathological retraction ring called Shroeder’s ring is seen abdominally. 
Obstructed lab is due to Cephalo-pelvic disproportion or neglected shoulder presentation in labour. There is formation of pathological retraction ring called as Bandl’s ring and it is seen abdominally. Multiparous patients have more risk of obstructed labour than nulliparous patients. Treatment of choice is emergency LSCS in order to prevent rupture of uterus.

questions.text: During obstetric examination of a primigravida with full-term gestation, it was found that the head of the baby was not engaged and there was suprapubic flattening. Fetal heart sounds were heard in the right flank region below the transverse umbilical line, lateral to right spino-umbilical line. What is the most likely position of the baby?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

ROP 
In this case the, head of the baby is in right occipito-posterior position and hence it is a case of malposition. Fetal heart sounds are heard lateral to spinal umbilical line on the right side which would mean flank region on the right side. This point corresponds to ROP position. On the left side it will be corresponding to LOP position.

choices.text: Three cm anterior to posterior fontanelle
Three cm posterior to posterior fontanelle
Three cm anterior to anterior fontanelle

questions.text: During vacuum delivery, the centre of the vacuum cup should be applied at?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Three cm anterior to posterior fontanelle 
Vacuum cup must be applied at a flexion point on the vertex presentation. It is three cm anterior to posterior fontanelle. It maintains the flexed attitude of the baby hence it is also called pivot point.

questions.text: The treatment of choice for septate uterus is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

hysteroscopic resection 
The treatment of choice for septate uterus is hysteroscopic septal resection. It is also called trans cervical septal resection. Septate uterus is the most common Mullerian anomaly and it is the worst Mullerian anomaly in pregnancy.

choices.text: Most common Mullerian anomaly is bicornuate uterus.
Worst Mullerian anomaly is arcuate uterus
Banana shaped uterus is seen in didelphys uterus
Mullerian anomaly with no fusion of Mullerian ducts is uterine didelphys

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about Mullerian anomalies?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Mullerian anomaly with no fusion of Mullerian ducts is uterine didelphys
The most common Mullerian anomaly is septate uterus. It is also the worst Mullerian anomaly in pregnancy. Banana shaped uterus is seen in unicornuate uterus. Mullerian anomaly with no fusion is uterine didelphys. There would be two hemi-uteri, two hemi-cervices and one or two vaginas.

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Labia minora -- scrotum 
Skene gland and prostate are homologous to each other. Their origin is urogenital sinus. Bartholin and Cowper glands are homologous to each other. Labia minora originates from genital folds and it is homologous to penile urethra and Labia majora originates from genital swelling and it is homologous to scrotum. Hilus cells are interstitial cells of ovaries and Leydig cells are interstitial cells of testes.

questions.text: Which one of the following is a caudal remnant of Wolffian tubule?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Paroophoron 
Wolffian duct and Wolffian tubules will undergo regression in female embryo. Caudal remnant of Wolffian tubule is called as Paroophoron. Cranial remnant is called Epoophoron which is also called organ of Rosenmüller. Wolffian duct forms Gartner’s duct.

questions.text: Androgen insensitivity syndrome is a disorder of which chromosome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Chromosome X 
Androgen insensitivity syndrome is an X linked recessive disease. Androgen receptors are absent in this case. Genotypic male baby is born with female external genitalia. It is the most common cause of male intersex.

questions.text: The most common symptom of a patient with genital tuberculosis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Infertility 
The most common symptom of genital tuberculosis is infertility. It is seen in 70% of the cases of genital tuberculosis. The most common organ involved in fallopian tube.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a case of azoospermia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Kartagener syndrome
Kartagener syndrome is ciliary motility disorder. It is a case of asthenozoospermia. All other cases cause azoospermia.

questions.text: Cancer of cervix spread to ureter causing hydronephrosis is staged as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stage three 
Cancer of cervix spread to the parametrial tissue reaching the lateral pelvic wall or involving the ureter causing ureteric obstruction and hydronephrosis is stage 3B cancer.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not responsible for an abnormally raised HCG in pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Edward’s syndrome
Edward syndrome has very low hCG in pregnancy. hCG is abnormally raised in molar pregnancy, Down’s syndrome, mistaken dates, Rh incompatibility and chronic renal failure.

choices.text: Inj. Methotrexate therapy by single dose regimen
Inj. Methotrexate therapy by multiple doses regimen

questions.text: A 32 years old nulliparous patient has an unruptured ectopic pregnancy in the isthmus of the fallopian tube. Her B-HCG level is 1209 IU/L. Her pulse is 83 per minute and BP is 104/78mm of Hg. There is no free fluid in the pouch of Douglas. Which of the following is the best way of treatment in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Inj. Methotrexate therapy by single dose regimen
In this case, beta hCG level is less than 5000 and patient is hemodynamically stable. She has unruptured ectopic pregnancy in the isthmus of the fallopian tube so we must treat by medical management and most common medical management is single dose regimen. It has less toxicity than multiple dose regimen.

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions cause ambiguous genitalia at birth?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

21-hydroxylase deficiency

Swyer syndrome has 46XY genotype with SRY gene defect. Turner syndrome has 45XO with monosomy. AIS is androgen insensitivity syndrome with absence of androgen receptors. All these cases have external genitalia of a female so the baby is phenotypically female in all these cases. In a case of 21 hydroxylase deficiency there would be an excess of androgen production from the adrenal gland. It is a case of congenital adrenal hypoplasia. Female baby is born with male external genitalia or ambiguous external genitalia. In fact, the most common cause of ambiguous genitalia at birth is congenital adrenal hyperplasia.

choices.text: Pulsatile GnRH agonists are given in case of infertility
EPRT is given if patient doesn’t desire fertility

questions.text: Which one of the following is incorrect regarding treatment of Sheehan’s syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pulsatile GnRH agonists are given in case of infertility

Pulsatile GnRH therapy is not given in a case of Sheehan syndrome because pituitary is not functional. Steroids, thyroxine and hormone replacement therapy by EPRT are given in Sheehan syndrome.

questions.text: A 24 years old Primigravida underwent full term normal delivery. During controlled cord traction, there was an avulsion of the cord. What is the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Do manual removal of placenta

Cord avulsion in third stage of labour can be managed by expected management but we follow active management of third stage of labour so we need to do manual removal of placenta under general anesthesia as the best line of management.

questions.text: Identify the given procedure:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pinard manoeuvre

In this picture, there is a breech presentation with extended legs. Examiner has put the hand inside the uterus and has unlocked the popliteal fossa to deliver the extended legs. This method is called as Pinard method.

questions.text:
Arrange the layers of placental barrier between maternal blood to fetal blood:

1: syncitio-trophoblast

2. extra embryonic mesoderm


3. fetal capillary endothelium

4. cytotrophoblast
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

1-4-2-3

Placental barrier is made up of layers of tertiary villi. From outside to inside, there would be syncitiotrophoblast, cytotrophoblast, extra embryonic mesoderm and fetal capillary endothelium.

questions.text: In PCOS, which of the following is not associated?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Raised prolactin

In a case of PCOS, there is anovulation and hence there is progesterone deficiency. Progesterone deficiency leads to loss of negative feedback on LH and hence LH is very high. High LH would lead to theca cell hypertrophy which would cause androgen excess. Androgens get converted into estrone in the periphery. So, E1:E2 ratio is increased. DHEAS is mildly increased and LH: FSH ratio is increased in other words FSH:LH ratio is decreased. Prolactin levels and thyroid levels are not altered in a case of PCOS.

choices.text: Granulosa cells produce oestradiol under control of FSH
Theca cells produce androstenedione under control of LH
Granulosa cells produce progesterone due to LH
Theca cells produce progesterone due to FSH

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true regarding steroidogenesis in ovary?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Theca cells produce progesterone due to FSH

There are two cells called granulosa cells and theca cells in ovary which are responsible for formation of hormones. Estrogen is formed from granulosa cells under the influence of FSH, androgens are formed from theca cells under the influence of LH. Progesterone is produced only when the granulosa cells get luteinised due to LH-surge.

questions.text: A 26 years old nulliparous patient with invasive mole has tumour size of 2 cm limited to uterus musculature. B-HCG is 15000 IU/L. There is a solitary lung metastasis of 2 cm size. There is no other metastasis. Her suction-evacuation was done for complete molar pregnancy 2 months back. Which of the following is correct treatment in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Single drug chemo

In this case, there is gestational trophoblastic neoplasm called invasive mole. Since the tumour is just two cm in size and there is a solitary lung nodule of two cm with hCG level of 15,000, this case will be considered as low risk GTN. The correct treatment for this patient would be single drug chemotherapy. We may either use methotrexate or Actinomycin-D.

questions.text: What is the most likely karyotype of the following pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

46XX

This is the picture of snowstorm appearance seen in a case of complete molar pregnancy. It is due to fertilization of an empty egg. The most common karyotype is 46XX which is found in 95% of the cases. It is due to mono-spermy diandry.

choices.text: It occurs one month before delivery to 5 months after delivery
2D echo shows ventricular dysfunction with reduced LVEF
There should be pre-existing cardiac lesion like mitral stenosis
There should be no other cause of CCF, like anemia, hyperthyroidism etc

questions.text: Which one of the following is not the criterion for the diagnosis of peripartum cardiomyopathy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

There should be pre-existing cardiac lesion like mitral stenosis

Peri partum cardiomyopathy is seen around labour, which means one month before delivery to five months after delivery. There is biventricular dysfunction caused by pregnancy. There is no other cause of CCF. There is no pre-existing cardiac lesion and there is a reduction in left ventricular ejection fraction.

questions.text:
The following statements are about the physiological changes in pregnancy. Which of the following are true?

1. Total protein concentration in blood increases in pregnancy

2. Oxygen binding capacity of blood is increased

3. Insulin levels and insulin resistance is more than in non-pregnant patient

4. Neutrophil count in blood is increased
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

2,3 and 4 are true

Regarding physiological changes in pregnancy, total protein concentration in blood reduces in pregnancy due to hemodilution. Oxygen binding capacity is increased due to effect caused by changes in the respiratory system in pregnancy. Insulin resistance is high in pregnancy because of HPL and other hormones. There is physiological neutrophilia and hence there is leucocytosis.

questions.text: According to the international association of diabetes in pregnancy study group (IADPSG), the plasma glucose concentration threshold for fasting, 1hr and 2 hr for the diagnosis of GDM are?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

F-92, 1HR-180, 2HR-153

According to IADPSG guideline, GDM is diagnosed if any one of the three values is abnormal: fasting= 92 or more, one hour= 180 or more, two hours =153 mg percentage or more.

choices.text: vitamin K intramuscularly and lactulose enema

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida with 34 weeks of gestation is complaining of pruritis since last 1 week. Her Sr. Bile acids are highly raised, SGOT, SGPT are 100iu/l. There is mild conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. Her viral markers are negative for viral hepatitis. What is the drug of choice in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ursodeoxycholic acid

There is 27 years old primigravida with pruritus of pregnancy with raised SGOT and SGPT along with mild conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. This has happened in third trimester so this is a case of intra hepatic cholestasis of pregnancy and the drug of choice in this case is ursodeoxycholic acid we must terminate pregnancy at 37 weeks.

questions.text: A 32 years old P2L2 patient has developed pelvic inflammatory disease. Which of the following kit would be prescribed to her and her partner respectively?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

yellow and grey

There is a case of pelvic inflammatory disease and according to syndromic management, we give kit number six to the patient and kit number one to the partner of the patient. Kit no.6 is called yellow kit and kit no.1 is called as Gray kit. Yellow kit contains doxycycline, metronidazole and cefixime. Gray kit contains azithromycin and cefixime.

questions.text: Which of the following structures originates from UROGENITAL SINUS?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Bartholin’s gland

Urogenital sinus is responsible for formation of lower 2/3 of vagina, vaginal epithelium, urinary bladder, urethra, Skene’s gland, Bartholin’s gland and hymen.

questions.text: A 37 years old male has azoospermia with very high levels of Sr. FSH. What is the most likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Klinefelter syndrome

High levels of serum FSH with azoospermia would mean testicular failure and testicular failure is seen in Klinefelter syndrome.

choices.text: It is more common in COC pill users
Itching is the most common symptom

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true regarding this patient who had vaginal discharge with inflammation with the following wet mount preparation finding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

pH is >4.5

This patient has vaginal discharge with wet mount preparation showing pseudo-hyphae. It means she is suffering from fungal infection. It is seen in patients using high dose COC pills, pregnancy or immunocompromise status. Itching is the most common symptom and pH of vagina is less than 4.5.

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida has developed Genito-urinary infection. Match the correct drug for the given infection.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1-B,2-D,3-A,4-C

Chlamydia trachomatis is treated by azithromycin or doxycycline. Neisseria gonorrhoea is treated by third generation cephalosporin like cefixime or ceftriaxone. Gardnerella vaginalis is an anaerobic infection and the drug of choices metronidazole. Herpes is treated by antiviral drug called as acyclovir.

choices.text: Phenotype that of female, genotype is 46XX
Genotype 46XY, phenotype is of female and gonads of male
Gonads and genotype that of female

questions.text: True regarding testicular feminization syndrome:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Genotype 46XY, phenotype is of female and gonads of male

Testicular feminization syndrome has genotype of 46XY with androgen receptor deficiency. So, the genotype is male and phenotype is a female. The gonads are undescended testes.

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman was found to have Ca cervix, FIGO stage 2B. What would be the management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Radiotherapy plus chemotherapy

Carcinoma of cervix of stage 2B, stage three or stage four or bulky early cancers should be treated by chemoradiation therapy. Surgery is not done in advanced stages of carcinoma of cervix.

questions.text:
Which one of the following is done in a case of recurrent pregnancy losses?

1: usg pelvis

2: aPTT

3: TORCH titres

4: Fetal karyotype
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

1 and 2

For evaluation of recurrent pregnancy loss, we need to check autoimmune condition like APLA syndrome, the anatomy by ultrasound and endocrine disorders. We also need to check karyotype of the couple for ruling out genetic cause of recurrent pregnancy loss. TORCH titres and fetal karyotype are not done in a case of recurrent pregnancy loss.

choices.text: If 4 injections of MTx fail then 4 more injections should be given
If b-HCG falls by 10?ter any injection of MTx then no further injections are needed
If b-HCG falls by 15?ter any injection of MTx then no further injections are needed
If b-HCG falls by 15% then the treatment is stopped after 4 doses of MTx

questions.text: In a multiple dose therapy for an unruptured ectopic, which one of the following statements is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

If b-HCG falls by 15

questions.text: A 72 years old female has third degree uterine prolapse with enterocoele. Which of the following anatomical structures is not repaired in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Pubo-vesical fascia

In a case of uterine prolapse with enterocoele in an elderly patient, we need to do vaginal hysterectomy with McCall’s culdoplasty with posterior colpoperineorrhaphy. Since there is no cystocele or urethrocele, there is no need to repair pubo vesical fascia.

choices.text: Cervical mucous shows ferning pattern on day 22
Non stretchable cervical mucous on day 22
Vaginal cytology showing predominance of intermediate cells

questions.text: Which of the following clinical/investigational scenario does not match with ovulatory cycle?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cervical mucous shows ferning pattern on day 22

Ovulatory cycle would have progesterone predominance in the second half of the cycle. The endometrium will show secretory changes with sub nuclear vacuolation, cervical mucus will show loss of ferning pattern and loss of stretchability. Vaginal cytology will show predominance of intermediate cells.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not suitable for treatment with Methotrexate therapy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Methotrexate therapy is not allowed in heterotrophic ectopic pregnancy because it will destroy the intrauterine pregnancy as well. We do laparoscopic surgery for heterotrophic ectopic pregnancy.
